module.name: project_breakdown
module.keywords: module, systems engineering, project breakdown, project management, product breakdown

abstract.li: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of relationships between project, product, associated high level breakdowns and properties.

module.purpose:
This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of relationships between project, product, associated high level breakdowns and properties.
The Project_breakdown_arm is about the identification of a project and product structure, i.e. how a project is defined and a product is assembled, categorized, and version controlled. It is not about the identification of configuration items .
The Project_breakdown_arm contains the information that identifies a product or a product version and the inclusion of a product or product version in a product category. It contains the characterization of a version of a product, suitable for one or more application domains and one or more life-cycle stages. It contains the context-dependent relationship among product definitions such as the fact that one or more versions of products are used in another product.
The Project_breakdown_arm contains the identification of a hierarchical breakdown of a product and the identification of the elements that comprise a breakdown. It includes the identification of parent-child relationships between breakdown elements, and the identification of relationships between elements in different breakdowns.
It contains identification of a kind of product from user requirements and the identification of a set of products grouped together for a common purpose, such as sales/marketing, analysis, production, usage, support activity, support solution and disposal. It contains the reference to the stakeholder for the group, who causes the creation of the group, along with the identification of a group as a subset of another group. It contains the list of common characteristics which is shared by the members of the group, such as scheduled for maintenance, sales, upgrading.
It contains the identification of project and product information selected for configuration management activities.

inscope.li: representation of the information to define and relate information associated with project breakdown;
identification of a universe of discourse suitable for the description of products;
identification of a kind of product from stakeholder and user requirements;
identification of and relationship between two projects;
identification and characterization of product, product version and relationships;
the identification of a breakdown, breakdown elements;
identification of the configuration of a product for a given product concept;
context-dependent relationship between two product definitions;
the identification of relationships between elements in different breakdowns;
identification of product information and definitions for configuration management purposes;
identification and definition and relationships between product categories;
representation of the data that identify a product;
association of a project item to product or property;
identification of a set of products grouped together for a common purpose;
identification of a group as a subset of another group.

outscope.li: association of project breakdown with activity or product data;
identification and characterization of project breakdown associated schedule;
identification and characterization of project breakdown associated person and organization;
identification and characterization of project breakdown associated work;
identification and characterization of project breakdown associated project management information resources;
the relationships between work, schedule, person and organization, project breakdown and project management information resources.
